actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate the special dependency requirements for entitlement to husband's and widower's insurance benefits and to make certain other changes so that benefits for husbands and widowers will be payable on the same basis as benefits for wives and widows.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Eliminates, under title II of the Social Security Act (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance), the special dependency requirements for entitlement to husband's and widower's insurance benefits, so that benefits for husbands and widowers will be payable on the same basis as benefits for wives and widows (under present law a widower must be able to show that half of his support was derived from his wife's earnings in order to qualify for survivors benefits; whereas no such proof is required of a widow receiving half her support from her husband's earnings.). Continues the benefits of a divorced husband who marries a person entitled to such benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate the special dependency requirements for entitlement to husband's and widower's insurance benefits and to make certain other changes so that benefits for husbands and widowers will be payable on the same basis as benefits for wives and widows.
